author: Special Correspondent
text:
The High Court of Karnataka on Wednesday ordered issue of notice to the State government on a petition questioning selection of Kannada film Banaadi for the State film award-2014 under the children’s movie category.

Justice A.S. Bopanna passed the order on a petition filed by Sri Sai Balaji Combines, which produced the children’s movie Billion Dollar Baby .

It was claimed in the petition that Billion Dollar Baby had highlighted may social issues such as global warming and preservation of environment, among others, and the movie was selected by the Film Federation of India as one of the films for Oscar Awards. The authorities with a malafide intention and for extraneous reasons selected Banaadi for the award instead of Billion Dollar Baby , which had 813 shows across the State, including an eight-week-long show in Bengaluru, the petitioner alleged. The selection committee, which comprised mainly commercial filmmakers, had failed to properly evaluate the petitioner’s film for the award, it was alleged in the petition.
title: Children’s film award: HC orders notice to Karnataka govt.
